item.title: 美国即将加征关税，中国称已做好应对更大冲击的准备
item.description: 中国国务院总理李强表示，在全球为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普下月宣布对其贸易伙伴征收更多关税做好准备之际，中国已做好应对 "超出预期的冲击 "的准备。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang said the country is prepared for “shocks that exceed expectations” as the world braces for US President Donald Trump to announce more tariffs on its trading partners next month.】

item.title: 里夫斯在春季声明中排除了提高税收的可能性
item.description: 蕾切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）已排除在下周的春季声明中提高税收的可能性。【原文：Rachel Reeves has ruled out raising taxes in next week's Spring Statement.】

item.title: 万亿美元印度航线考验忠诚零售商的决心
item.description: 印度 1.2 万亿美元的股票大跌开始让散户投资者担忧，在全球资金外流的情况下，散户投资者几个月来一直在支持印度市场。【原文：India’s $1.2 trillion equity rout is starting to worry its legions of retail investors who have supported the market for months amid an exodus of global funds.】

item.title: 澳大利亚财长警告美国全球经济将面临 "震荡性 "冲击
item.description: 澳大利亚财长吉姆-查莫斯（Jim Chalmers）在本周二公布其第四份国家预算之前警告说，美国新政府的政策将对全球经济产生 "震撼性 "影响。【原文：Australia’s Treasurer Jim Chalmers has warned the impact of the new US administration’s policies will have a “seismic” impact on the global economy, ahead of his fourth national budget due to be handed down on Tuesday.】

item.title: 英国计划投入 6 亿英镑培训更多熟练建筑工人
item.description: 英国政府打算在未来四年内向建筑业投资 6 亿英镑（7.75 亿美元），以推进基础设施建设计划。【原文：The UK government intends to invest £600 million ($775 million) in the construction sector over the next four years as it moves ahead with plans to boost infrastructure.】

item.title: 加勒比海地区担心对中国制造船只罚款的影响
item.description: 圭亚那总统伊尔法安-阿里（Irfaan Ali）周六表示，加勒比共同体（CARICOM）领导人将于下周向美国国务卿马尔科-鲁比奥（Marco Rubio）表示，美国拟对中国制造的货轮处以罚款的做法将损害该地区的石油和天然气产业，并推高运输成本。【原文：Caribbean Community (CARICOM) leaders will tell Secretary of State Marco Rubio next week that the US’s proposed fines on Chinese-made cargo vessels would hurt the region’s oil and gas industry as well as push up transportation costs, Guyana’s President Irfaan Ali said Saturday.】

item.title: 棘手的美国通胀和关税让美联储束手无策
item.description: 美国通胀率仍处于令美联储官员不安的水平，而特朗普政府正在推进关税措施，这有可能使物价压力持续升高。【原文：US inflation remains at a disquieting level for Federal Reserve officials, just as the Trump administration moves forward with tariffs that risk keeping price pressures elevated.】

item.title: 美国混乱助推中国债务走出低谷
item.description: 关税和经济前景放缓引发的美国市场动荡正在提升中国企业债的吸引力，而不到六个月前，一些信贷经理还认为中国企业债不可投资。【原文：US market turmoil triggered by tariffs and a slowing economic outlook is boosting the appeal of Chinese corporate debt that less than six months ago was considered uninvestable by some credit managers.】

item.title: OpenAI、Meta 寻求与印度 Reliance 结盟：信息
item.description: 据 The Information 报道，OpenAI 和 Meta Platforms 公司正在寻求与印度信实工业有限公司建立潜在联盟。【原文：OpenAI and Meta Platforms Inc. are each seeking a potential alliance with India’s Reliance Industries Ltd., The Information reports.】

item.title: 特朗普计划在关税 "解放日 "推出更多有针对性的举措
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统即将发起的关税浪潮将比他偶尔威胁要发起的关税大潮更有针对性，他的助手和盟友说，这可能会缓解市场对全面关税战的焦虑。【原文：President Donald Trump’s coming wave of tariffs is poised to be more targeted than the barrage he has occasionally threatened, aides and allies say, a potential relief for markets gripped by anxiety about an all-out tariff war.】

item.title: 加拿大大选取决于谁能挽救受美国威胁的经济
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战使人们更加关注如何解决阻碍加拿大经济发展的长期问题，预计加拿大总理马克-卡尼将于周日投入竞选活动。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney is expected to plunge Canada into an election campaign on Sunday, as US President Donald Trump’s trade war sharpens the focus on fixing long-standing problems that have hindered the Canadian economy.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉称美国将于周日恢复遣返移民的航班
item.description: 据委内瑞拉一名高级官员称，在两国政府达成协议后，美国的驱逐航班将于周日恢复。【原文：Deportation flights from the US will resume on Sunday after an agreement was reached between the two governments, according to a top Venezuelan official.】

item.title: 印度运营商拒绝监管机构就酿酒纠纷提出的数据要求
item.description: 印度的航空公司拒绝分享政府监管机构所要求的机票价格数据，这与试图在一个近乎垄断的市场中加强对消费者保护的政策制定者发生了冲突。【原文：India’s airlines have refused to share data on airfares sought by the government regulator, setting up a clash with policymakers who are trying improve protections for consumers in a market that is a near-duopoly.】

item.title: 法国遭预算警告，DBRS评级转为负面
item.description: 晨星 DBRS 将法国的信用评级展望定为负面，并警告说，在国防开支需求不断增长和政治不稳定风险持续存在的情况下，法国的债务负担将进一步加重。【原文：Morningstar DBRS put a negative outlook on its assessment of France’s creditworthiness, adding to warnings over the country’s debt burden amid growing demands for defense spending and persistent risks of political instability.】

item.title: 索拉纳的 Memecoin 密谋让最热门的加密前沿黯然失色
item.description: 拉地毯狙击交易 "阴谋"对于那些不熟悉导致代币价格突然暴涨然后暴跌的阴谋诡计的人来说，索拉纳区块链上的memecoins小众世界充满了危险。【原文：Rug pulls. Sniping. Trading “cabals.” The niche world of memecoins on the Solana blockchain is rife with danger for those unfamiliar with the machinations that cause token prices to suddenly surge and then crash.】

item.title: 美国经济数据参差不齐，引人深思：经济放缓是否即将到来？
item.description: 美国经济数据差异巨大，引发了一场争论：唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易政策所带来的焦虑情绪是否会将正在缓和的经济推向严重衰退。【原文：US economic data are diverging wildly, fueling a debate over whether rising anxiety from President Donald Trump’s trade policies will push a moderating economy into a serious downturn.】

item.title: Oaktree 的 Banca Progetto 由意大利银行管理
item.description: 意大利银行已启动橡树资本管理公司（Oaktree Capital Management LP）旗下 Banca Progetto SpA 公司的特别管理程序，并任命独立经理人负责其运营。【原文：The Bank of Italy has started a special administration procedure for Oaktree Capital Management LP’s Banca Progetto SpA and appointed independent managers to run its operations.】

item.title: 习近平拥抱私营企业为何总能 "一击即溃"？
item.description: "你不可能是半个共产党员"。苏联著名历史学家、大国关系专家斯蒂芬-科特金如是说。他认为，这是一个非此即彼的命题。【原文：“You can’t be half-communist.” This according to Stephen Kotkin, a preeminent historian of the Soviet Union and expert on great-power relations. He contends it’s an all-or-nothing proposition.】

item.title: 拜耳在美国佐治亚州被判 20 亿美元的 Roundup 赔偿金
item.description: 拜耳公司（Bayer AG）被美国佐治亚州的一个陪审团勒令向一名声称其Roundup除草剂致癌的原告支付约21亿美元。【原文：Bayer AG was ordered by a jury in the US state of Georgia to pay about $2.1 billion to a plaintiff who claimed its Roundup weedkiller caused cancer, the latest setback in litigation that has already cost the German company about $10 billion.】

item.title: 穆迪确认波兰评级为 A2，称赞国防开支
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）确认波兰的长期外国发行人评级为 A2，评级展望为稳定，并表示波兰充满活力的经济和释放的欧盟资金缓解了预算资产负债表的恶化。【原文：Moody’s Ratings affirmed Poland’s long-term foreign issuer rating at A2 with a stable outlook, saying that its dynamic economy and unlocked European Union funds mitigate deterioration of the budget’s balance sheet.】

item.title: 西班牙媒体之争激化，激进对冲基金成猎物
item.description: 十年前，Amber Capital 创始人约瑟夫-奥胡尔良（Joseph Oughourlian）通过股东活动赢得了西班牙最具影响力的媒体集团的控制权。现在，他正在为下台而斗争。【原文：Amber Capital founder Joseph Oughourlian won control of Spain’s most influential media group after a shareholder activism campaign a decade ago. Now he’s the one fighting off an ouster.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：关税逼近，美联储、日本央行和英国央行维持利率不变
item.description: 过去一周，美国、日本和英国的央行行长在利率问题上按兵不动，选择了耐心的政策方针，以衡量关税对经济和通胀的影响。【原文：Central bankers in the US, Japan and UK held the line on interest rates this past week, opting for a patient policy approach in order to gauge the economic and inflationary impacts of tariffs.】

item.title: 莱维镇假色情制品受害者追捕骚扰者
item.description:
在第二集中，莱维敦的几十名应届高中毕业生发现自己的图像被用于伪造色情作品，并对执法部门感到不耐烦。【原文：

item.title: 希思罗机场称停电后已完全正常运行
item.description: 伦敦希思罗机场表示，在史无前例的长达一天的大停电导致欧洲最繁忙机场的数十万旅客出行停滞之后，该机场已经开放并全面投入运营。【原文：London’s Heathrow airport said it’s open and fully operational following an unprecedented daylong blackout that brought travel to a standstill for hundreds of thousands of passengers at Europe’s busiest airport.】

item.description: 列维敦 E2："我也在网站上"（播客）【原文：Levittown E2: ‘I’m Also on the Website’ (Podcast)】

item.title: 希思罗机场停电暴露机场供电薄弱环节
item.description: 伦敦希思罗机场周五史无前例地停电，使该机场对潜在脆弱基础设施的依赖成为焦点，而此时这个英国最大的枢纽机场正在为雄心勃勃的扩建计划进行游说。【原文：London Heathrow’s unprecedented blackout on Friday has put the airport’s reliance on potentially vulnerable infrastructure into focus, at a time when the biggest UK hub is lobbying for an ambitious expansion plan.】

item.title: 美国关税压力上升，日中两国讨论经济问题
item.description: 日本和中国周六在东京举行了六年来的首次经济对话，此次活动旨在缓解亚洲巨人之间面临美国贸易压力时的紧张关系。【原文：Japan and China held their first economic dialogue in six years in Tokyo on Saturday, an event aimed at reducing tensions between the Asian giants as they face trade pressure from the US.】

item.title: 卡尼推出加拿大关税减免和 "国家建设 "改革方案
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）在预计将举行大选的前几天宣布了一系列旨在减轻美国关税带来的痛苦的措施，以及旨在促进贸易和投资的 "国家建设 "改革。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney announced a flurry of measures aimed at blunting the pain of US tariffs as well as “nation-building” reforms to boost trade and investment days before he’s expected to call an election.】

item.title: StubHub 联合创始人首次股票发行之路曲折坎坷
item.description: 这一次，埃里克-贝克出售的不是音乐会门票。而是 StubHub 控股公司（StubHub Holdings Inc.【原文：This time it isn’t concert tickets Eric Baker is selling. It’s shares of StubHub Holdings Inc., the company he co-founded and has owned on and off for a quarter century.】
